data.title: DJ Khaled's Net Worth and Story
data.meta_description: Find out DJ Khaled's net worth and discover the secrets that have pushed him so far ahead in the world of hip-hop music.
data.text:
DJ Khaled is one of the rap and hip-hop music industry’s major influencers, artists, and producers. He is often seen with an expressive intro in music videos and using the famous catchphrases “DJ Khaled!, We The Best Music and Another One.” There is hardly a mainstream singer or rapper who has not worked with him.

What is DJ Khaled's net worth?

DJ Khaled’s extensive ventures of music production, disc jockeying, endorsements, and investments have made him an estimated net worth of $75 million, a substantial increase from his estimated $40 million net worth in 2019.

Who is DJ Khaled?

Khaled Mohammed Khaled, most famously known as DJ Khaled, is an American rap artist, record producer, hypeman, and disc jockey (DJ). He was born on November 16, 1975, to Palestinian immigrant parents and is the brother of actor Alaa Khaled. As a young boy, he had a passion for rap music at a young age and worked at a local Merry-Go-Round record store which further fueled his interest. In the early 1990s, he met young rappers such as Lil Wayne, Lil Baby, and Birdman and helped create their records before their rise to stardom.

In the late 1990s, he became famous as a radio host for 99 Jamz in Miami and joined the group Terror Squad as their DJ in hosted events. Afterward, he ventured into music, producing his first album in 2006, Listennn..the Album. It featured other prominent rappers such as Jadakiss, Young Jeezy, Juelz Santana, and Slim Thug and hit singles with the likes of Lil Wayne, Fat Joe, Rick Ross, Kanye West, John Legend, and Pitbull.

The success of his first album led to subsequent releases

We the Best in 2007

We Global in 2008

Victory in 2010

We the Best Forever in 2011

Kiss the Ring in 2012

Suffering from Success in 2013

I Changed a Lot in 2015

Major Key in 2016

Grateful in 2017

Father of Asahd in 2019

Khaled Khaled in 2021

God did in 2022

All of his production had singles that were certified gold and his guest artists’ contributions made the albums commercial successes which eventually earned DJ Khaled his first grammy award victory in 2020.

He is married to Nicole Tuck and has two sons, Asahd Tuck Khaled and Aalam Tuck Khaled.

How did DJ Khaled make his money?

DJ Khaled makes his income from his record releases, music partnerships, best-seller book, The Keys, investments, acting, DJing, and record label, We the Best Music Group. He also has online platforms such as his website, DJ KHALED, and online store, We The Best Store,

3 Success Lessons from DJ Khaled

DJ Khaled uses his media to give his fans and viewers nuggets of wisdom. His book, published in 2016, The Keys, comprises full-fledged advice on living and success. Among some of such bits of wisdom are the following:

1. Nothing is Free in Life

DJ Khaled believes that hard work and paying one’s due are crucial for everything earned or desired.

2. Surround Yourself With Positive Energy

DJ Khaled is a staunch believer in positive energy; focusing on it helps improve productivity and a healthy lifestyle.

3. You Are the Key to Your Success

DJ Khaled is intentional about his successes which is often reflected in his personal and collaborated productions. As such, he acknowledges that playing one’s part in achieving goals and being persistent and responsible for the results is necessary.

FAQs

How much is DJ Khaled's net worth?

DJ Khaled has an estimated network of $75 million.

How did DJ Khaled become famous?

DJ Khaled became recognized as a DJ at live performances of the Terror Squad collective and more so after he released his first album, Listennn…The Album was in 2006. His works featuring guest appearances also promoted his fame across the rap and hip-hop music industry.

What are some of the hip-hop albums DJ Khaled has made?

DJ Khaled has made the following albums over the years:

We the Best in 2007

We Global in 2008

Victory in 2010

We the Best Forever in 2011

Kiss the Ring in 2012

Suffering from Success in 2013

I Changed a Lot in 2015

Major Key in 2016

Grateful in 2017

Father of Asahd in 2019

Khaled Khaled in 2021

God did in 2022

What awards and endorsements have DJ Khaled received?

DJ Khaled has received the following awards:

Ozone Awards for Best Radio DJ, Best Video, and DJ of the Year in 2008

BET Hip Hop Awards for DJ of the Year in 2008, 2012, 2013, 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2019

BET Hip Hop Awards for MVP of the Year in 2009, 2016, and 2017

American Music Award for Favorite Rap/Hip-Hop Song in 2017

Urban Music Awards for Best International Act in 2017

Teen Choice Award for Choice R&B/Hip-Hop Song in 2017

Soul Train Music Award for Best Collaboration in 2017

BET Hip Hop Awards for Producer of the Year in 2018 and 2019

MTV Video Awards for Best Collaboration in 2018

iHeartRadio Music Award for Hip-Hop Song of the Year in 2018

Grammy Award for Best Rap/Sung Performance in 2020

MTV Europe Music Award for Best Video n 2021

He has received endorsement deals from prominent establishments such as Dolce and Gabbana, Weight Watchers, Apple, and Ciroc.

How has DJ Khaled's success in the hip-hop industry impacted his net worth?

The entertainer’s success has significantly contributed to his net worth with an evident increase in sales of his records, endorsements, and impressive collaborations.

What collaboration projects have DJ Khaled been involved in?

The music producer has undertaken remarkable collaborations with prominent singers. Some of his best include:

“I’m The One” with Justin Bieber, Chance The Rapper, Quavo, and Lil Wayne

“All I Do Is Win” with Ludacris, T Pain, Rick Ross, and Snoop Dogg

“Wild Thoughts” With Rihanna and Bryson Tiller

“I'm So Hood” feat. T-Pain, Trick Daddy, Plies, and Rick Ross

"No New Friends” feat. Drake, Lil Wayne, and Rick Ross

How has DJ Khaled's fame and charisma impacted his net worth?

The superstar’s fame and charisma have invited multiple endorsement deals with influential brands, adding immensely to his net worth over the years.

What sponsorships and endorsements does DJ Khaled have?

DJ Khaled’s label, We The Best Music Group, is affiliated with Epic Records, a subsidiary of Sony Music Entertainment. They have been distributors of his albums since his label’s inception in 2008. He also has massive endorsement deals with major companies and premium brands such as Dolce and Gabbana, ESPN Music, Amazon Music, Weight Watchers, Apple, T-Mobile, Crocs, Endexx corporation, Ciroc, and Dove Men+Care.

What properties does DJ Khaled own?

DJ Khaled owns a $25.9 million waterfront home in Miami and several luxury cars including a Rolls Royce, Dawn Convertible, a metal black Ghost Sedan, Phantom VIII, Cadillac Escalade, Landaulet, 2012 57s, and Range Rover.

What are some DJ Khaled's investments?

DJ Khaled has a furniture line modeled after his home setting called We The Best Home, the platform Protégé that helps young talent, and EngineEars, a marketplace for audio creators.

Takeaway

DJ Khaled is the ultimate hustler and a true inspiration for entrepreneurs everywhere. He's not just a multi-platinum selling artist and music producer, but also a savvy businessman who has built a empire through his personal brand and massive social media following.

He's the king of collaborations and has worked with the biggest names in the industry. But that's not all, he's also a bestselling author, motivational speaker and has even launched his own record label and management company.

He's a true embodiment of the entrepreneurial spirit and a living proof that with hard work and determination you can achieve anything. Take a page out of Khaled's book and let's hustle like him.

If you’re an aspiring music artist who wants to break into the business, we’re probably not going to be much help to you (though we may become your fans!). That’s just not our specialty.

But if you want to build a million dollar business that can make the world a better place and make you very, very rich? That’s what we do!

In fact, we’re on a mission to make one million millionaires by 2028.
